items.q: Fill in the blank: She received a nice ___ on her presentation.
Fill in the blank: That scarf really ___ your eyes.
Choose the sentence that uses 'compliment' correctly.
options: The soup was a perfect compliment to the bread.
He gave her a compliment on her new haircut.
Their skills compliment each other well.
The colors complemented her with compliments.

items.q: Choose the sentence that uses 'complement' correctly.
options: The wine was a nice complement to the meal.
The teacher complimented the students' homework.
She received many complements about her dress.

items.q: Identify the sentence with the error.
options: He complimented her on her hard work.
The sauce is a perfect complement to the dish.
He wrote a long complement on her performance.

items.q: Fill in the blanks: 'They ___ each other often, and their skills ___ each other too.'
Choose the best option: 'The team's diverse talents are a great ___ to one another.'

options: 'Compliment' is praise; 'complement' means to complete or go well with.
'Compliment' means to complete; 'complement' means to praise.
'Complement' is always negative; 'compliment' is always positive.

items.q: Fill in the blank: He blushed when he heard her ___ about his cooking.
Fill in the blank: These two colors ___ each other very well.
Identify the sentence that is completely correct.
options: Her feedback was a nice complement on my work.
Her feedback was a nice compliment on my work.
Her feedback was a nice complementary on my work.
Her feedback was a nice compliment that complemented my confidence.

items.q: Choose the sentence with the mistake.
options: The dessert was a perfect complement to the meal.
He gave her a sincere compliment.
She received many complements on her performance.

items.q: Fill in the blanks: 'We should ___ the chef; this dish is the perfect ___ to the main course.'
Which sentence correctly uses both nouns?
options: Her kind complements were a real compliment to my efforts.
Her kind compliments were a real complement to my efforts.
Her kind compliments were a real complementary to my efforts.
Her kind complement were a real compliments to my efforts.

items.q: Choose the sentence that is completely correct.
options: The shirt is complimentary to your eyes.
The shirt really complements your eyes.
The shirt really compliments your eyes' complement.
The shirt is a nice compliment to your eyes.

items.q: Fill in the blank: 'The hotel offered a ___ breakfast to all guests.'
Identify the sentence that is completely correct.
options: Her skills compliment his, making them a strong team.
Her skills complement his, making them a strong team.
Her skills complementary his, making them a strong team.
Her skills are complimentary his, making them a strong team.

items.q: In the sentence 'He took her comment as a compliment', what does 'compliment' mean?
In the sentence 'That side dish is a perfect complement to the main course', what does 'complement' mean?
